channel.title: Pre-made Search Application
channel.description:
Hey, does anyone know of any pre-made GUIs out there that I can use as a search application? Just add my own database of Strings and it flags any words that I have searched?
I want to develop one, but not from scratch. I'm too busy at the moment to learn Swing and create it from scratch (although I'm sure it wouldn't take long for those who are used to it, I just don't feel up to it).
Thanks. :/

item.title: Pre-made Search Application
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:12, topic:424454”][quote author=The Outsider link=topic=527110.msg3841500#msg3841500 date=1323285575]
To be more specific:

A simple database that I write from scratch which is just lines of text.

You get some logs.
You swing your axe at the tree…
You need an axe of which you have the level to use to cut this tree.
//etc.[/quote]

I then want to be able to search a keyword and it bring up all Strings that contain that keyword(s).

Ohhhhh one you write, then yeah. I can create one for you. Pm me more info about the database.[/quote]

Well you see that’s the thing, I want to document messages from RuneScape for use in the private server community. Then have it as a tool for people who create RS remakes.

Read full topic

item.title: Pre-made Search Application
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

To be more specific:

A simple database that I write from scratch which is just lines of text.

You get some logs. You swing your axe at the tree... You need an axe of which you have the level to use to cut this tree. //etc.

I then want to be able to search a keyword and it bring up all Strings that contain that keyword(s).

just like “partyhat” on Mopar’s client brings up “White partyhat” “Blue partyhat” etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Pre-made Search Application
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

The Outsider:

^So say I can’t remember the sendMessage for “You get some logs.” and I type in “logs”. Would it find a String containing “logs”? Or would it have to be exact?

You’d have to loop through all the files in multiple folders then. And it would possibly show any other instance containing “logs”

Read full topic

item.title: Pre-made Search Application
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

^So say I can’t remember the sendMessage for “You get some logs.” and I type in “logs”. Would it find a String containing “logs”? Or would it have to be exact?

A simple database that I write from scratch which is just lines of text.

You get some logs. You swing your axe at the tree... You need an axe of which you have the level to use to cut this tree. //etc.

I then want to be able to search a keyword and it bring up all Strings that contain that keyword(s).

item.title: Pre-made Search Application
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

You don’t even need a GUI if you just want a basic searcher.

		Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in);
		String input = scan.nextLine();
		System.out.println(input);
		String Dir = "";
		if(Dir.contains(input)/** Make it loop through the directory you want.**/) {
			//Do what you want.
			System.out.println("Found the place.");
		}

[quote=“The Outsider, post:7, topic:424454”]Ah yes. I kind of want the same concept as the item list searcher on Mopar’s client, except for something else. I wouldn’t know how to manipulate the .jar and re-jar so was hoping there were some open source applications out there.

And no, I just want to search the database that is contained within the application or whatever. I’m using it for sendMessage Strings if it’s any constellation.[/quote]
What type of database though? Be more specific.

Read full topic

item.title: Pre-made Search Application
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Ah yes. I kind of want the same concept as the item list searcher on Mopar’s client, except for something else. I wouldn’t know how to manipulate the .jar and re-jar so was hoping there were some open source applications out there.

And no, I just want to search the database that is contained within the application or whatever. I’m using it for sendMessage Strings if it’s any constellation.

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

zFileSearcher (the prefix is just so it appears at the bottom of file lists I assume) has always been circulating around the 508 scene, in almost every base. Pretty sure it’s been taken to others to.

I’ll see if I can find it for ya.

Read full topic
